snippet: In a new study of Swedish women, regular moderate consumption of beer, wine or liquor was associated with a lower risk of developing rheumatoid arthritis.
abstract: In a new study of Swedish women, regular moderate consumption of beer, wine or liquor was associated with a lower risk of developing rheumatoid arthritis.

headline.main: A Cocktail May Cut Rheumatoid Arthritis Risk
headline.print_headline: Vital Signs | Patterns: A Cocktail May Cut Women’s Arthritis Risk
